etymologies: Middle English (originally denoting the jackdaw): probably imitative

definitions: a black Eurasian and North African bird of the crow family, with a down-curved bill and broad rounded wings, typically frequenting mountains and sea cliffs.

notes.text: Genus Pyrrhocorax, family Corvidae: three species, especially the red-billed chough (P. pyrrhocorax), with a long red bill, and the alpine chough (P. graculus), with a shorter yellow bill

shortDefinitions: black Eurasian and North African bird of crow family
